body_html:
Hi @PatWie it's a large contribution to review, and to maintain. Since tf.contrib is going to be retired, there is limited value to adding significant new contributions, unless they are so significant that they will be moved into core quickly.

With straight python code, the best route is probably for one to host in a separate repo. Having gone through the exercise myself, I can attest that it is not completely trivial to have C++ ops in an external project at this point.

body:
Hi @PatWie it's a large contribution to review, and to maintain. Since `tf.contrib` is going to be retired, there is limited value to adding significant new contributions, unless they are so significant that they will be moved into core quickly.

With straight python code, the best route is probably for one to host in a separate repo. Having gone through the exercise myself, I can attest that it is not completely trivial to have `C++` ops in an external project at this point.
